00078 static void
00079 osd_object_sa_fini(struct osd_object *obj)
00080 {
00081         if (obj->oo_sa_hdl) {
00082                 sa_handle_destroy(obj->oo_sa_hdl);
00083                 obj->oo_sa_hdl = NULL;
00084         }
00085 }
00086 
00087 static int
00088 osd_object_sa_init(struct osd_object *obj, struct osd_device *o)
00089 {
00090         int rc;
00091 
00092         LASSERT(obj->oo_sa_hdl == NULL);
00093         LASSERT(obj->oo_db != NULL);
00094 
00095         rc = -sa_handle_get(o->od_os, obj->oo_db->db_object, obj,
00096                             SA_HDL_PRIVATE, &obj->oo_sa_hdl);
00097         if (rc)
00098                 return rc;
00099 
00100         /* Cache the xattr object id, valid for the life of the object */
00101         rc = -sa_lookup(obj->oo_sa_hdl, SA_ZPL_XATTR(o), &obj->oo_xattr, 8);
00102         if (rc == -ENOENT) {
00103                 obj->oo_xattr = ZFS_NO_OBJECT;
00104                 rc = 0;
00105         } else if (rc) {
00106                 osd_object_sa_fini(obj);
00107         }
00108 
00109         return rc;
00110 }
00111 
00112 /*
00113  * Add object to list of dirty objects in tx handle.
00114  */
00115 static void
00116 osd_object_sa_dirty_add(struct osd_object *obj, struct osd_thandle *oh)
00117 {
00118         if (!list_empty(&obj->oo_sa_linkage))
00119                 return;
00120 
00121         down(&oh->ot_sa_lock);
00122         write_lock(&obj->oo_attr_lock);
00123         if (likely(list_empty(&obj->oo_sa_linkage)))
00124                 list_add(&obj->oo_sa_linkage, &oh->ot_sa_list);
00125         write_unlock(&obj->oo_attr_lock);
00126         up(&oh->ot_sa_lock);
00127 }
00128 
00129 /*
00130  * Release spill block dbuf hold for all dirty SAs.
00131  */
00132 void osd_object_sa_dirty_rele(struct osd_thandle *oh)
00133 {
00134         struct osd_object *obj;
00135 
00136         down(&oh->ot_sa_lock);
00137         while (!list_empty(&oh->ot_sa_list)) {
00138                 obj = list_entry(oh->ot_sa_list.next,
00139                                  struct osd_object, oo_sa_linkage);
00140                 sa_spill_rele(obj->oo_sa_hdl);
00141                 write_lock(&obj->oo_attr_lock);
00142                 list_del_init(&obj->oo_sa_linkage);
00143                 write_unlock(&obj->oo_attr_lock);
00144         }
00145         up(&oh->ot_sa_lock);
00146 }
00147 
00148 /*
00149  * Update the SA and add the object to the dirty list.
00150  */
00151 int osd_object_sa_update(struct osd_object *obj, sa_attr_type_t type,
00152                          void *buf, uint32_t buflen, struct osd_thandle *oh)
00153 {
00154         int rc;
00155 
00156         LASSERT(obj->oo_sa_hdl != NULL);
00157         LASSERT(oh->ot_tx != NULL);
00158 
00159         rc = -sa_update(obj->oo_sa_hdl, type, buf, buflen, oh->ot_tx);
00160         osd_object_sa_dirty_add(obj, oh);
00161 
00162         return rc;
00163 }
00164 
00165 /*
00166  * Bulk update the SA and add the object to the dirty list.
00167  */
00168 static int
00169 osd_object_sa_bulk_update(struct osd_object *obj, sa_bulk_attr_t *attrs,
00170                           int count, struct osd_thandle *oh)
00171 {
00172         int rc;
00173 
00174         LASSERT(obj->oo_sa_hdl != NULL);
00175         LASSERT(oh->ot_tx != NULL);
00176 
00177         rc = -sa_bulk_update(obj->oo_sa_hdl, attrs, count, oh->ot_tx);
00178         osd_object_sa_dirty_add(obj, oh);
00179 
00180         return rc;
00181 }

00183 /*
00184  * Retrieve the attributes of a DMU object
00185  */
00186 int __osd_object_attr_get(const struct lu_env *env, struct osd_device *o,
00187                           struct osd_object *obj, struct lu_attr *la)
00188 {
00189         struct osa_attr *osa = &osd_oti_get(env)->oti_osa;
00190         sa_handle_t     *sa_hdl;
00191         sa_bulk_attr_t  *bulk;
00192         int              cnt = 0;
00193         int              rc;
00194         ENTRY;
00195 
00196         LASSERT(obj->oo_db != NULL);
00197 
00198         rc = -sa_handle_get(o->od_os, obj->oo_db->db_object, NULL,
00199                             SA_HDL_PRIVATE, &sa_hdl);
00200         if (rc)
00201                 RETURN(rc);
00202 
00203         OBD_ALLOC(bulk, sizeof(sa_bulk_attr_t) * 9);
00204         if (bulk == NULL)
00205                 GOTO(out_sa, rc = -ENOMEM);
00206 
00207         la->la_valid |= LA_ATIME | LA_MTIME | LA_CTIME | LA_MODE | LA_TYPE |
00208                         LA_SIZE | LA_UID | LA_GID | LA_FLAGS | LA_NLINK;
00209 
00210         SA_ADD_BULK_ATTR(bulk, cnt, SA_ZPL_ATIME(o), NULL, osa->atime, 16);
00211         SA_ADD_BULK_ATTR(bulk, cnt, SA_ZPL_MTIME(o), NULL, osa->mtime, 16);
00212         SA_ADD_BULK_ATTR(bulk, cnt, SA_ZPL_CTIME(o), NULL, osa->ctime, 16);
00213         SA_ADD_BULK_ATTR(bulk, cnt, SA_ZPL_MODE(o), NULL, &osa->mode, 8);
00214         SA_ADD_BULK_ATTR(bulk, cnt, SA_ZPL_SIZE(o), NULL, &osa->size, 8);
00215         SA_ADD_BULK_ATTR(bulk, cnt, SA_ZPL_LINKS(o), NULL, &osa->nlink, 8);
00216         SA_ADD_BULK_ATTR(bulk, cnt, SA_ZPL_UID(o), NULL, &osa->uid, 8);
00217         SA_ADD_BULK_ATTR(bulk, cnt, SA_ZPL_GID(o), NULL, &osa->gid, 8);
00218         SA_ADD_BULK_ATTR(bulk, cnt, SA_ZPL_FLAGS(o), NULL, &osa->flags, 8);
00219 
00220         rc = -sa_bulk_lookup(sa_hdl, bulk, cnt);
00221         if (rc)
00222                 GOTO(out_bulk, rc);
00223 
00224         la->la_atime = osa->atime[0];
00225         la->la_mtime = osa->mtime[0];
00226         la->la_ctime = osa->ctime[0];
00227         la->la_mode = osa->mode;
00228         la->la_uid = osa->uid;
00229         la->la_gid = osa->gid;
00230         la->la_nlink = osa->nlink;
00231         la->la_flags = attrs_zfs2fs(osa->flags);
00232         la->la_size = osa->size;
00233 
00234         /* Try to get extra flag from LMA. Right now, only LMAI_ORPHAN
00235          * flags is stored in LMA, and it is only for orphan directory */
00236         if (S_ISDIR(la->la_mode) && dt_object_exists(&obj->oo_dt)) {
00237                 struct osd_thread_info *info = osd_oti_get(env);
00238                 struct lustre_mdt_attrs *lma;
00239                 struct lu_buf buf;
00240 
00241                 lma = (struct lustre_mdt_attrs *)info->oti_buf;
00242                 buf.lb_buf = lma;
00243                 buf.lb_len = sizeof(info->oti_buf);
00244                 rc = osd_xattr_get(env, &obj->oo_dt, &buf, XATTR_NAME_LMA);
00245                 if (rc > 0) {
00246                         rc = 0;
00247                         lma->lma_incompat = le32_to_cpu(lma->lma_incompat);
00248                         obj->oo_lma_flags =
00249                                 lma_to_lustre_flags(lma->lma_incompat);
00250 
00251                 } else if (rc == -ENODATA) {
00252                         rc = 0;
00253                 }
00254         }
00255 
00256         if (S_ISCHR(la->la_mode) || S_ISBLK(la->la_mode)) {
00257                 rc = -sa_lookup(sa_hdl, SA_ZPL_RDEV(o), &osa->rdev, 8);
00258                 if (rc)
00259                         GOTO(out_bulk, rc);
00260                 la->la_rdev = osa->rdev;
00261                 la->la_valid |= LA_RDEV;
00262         }
00263 out_bulk:
00264         OBD_FREE(bulk, sizeof(sa_bulk_attr_t) * 9);
00265 out_sa:
00266         sa_handle_destroy(sa_hdl);
00267 
00268         RETURN(rc);
00269 }
00270 
00271 int __osd_obj2dbuf(const struct lu_env *env, objset_t *os,
00272                    uint64_t oid, dmu_buf_t **dbp)
00273 {
00274         dmu_object_info_t *doi = &osd_oti_get(env)->oti_doi;
00275         int rc;
00276 
00277         rc = -sa_buf_hold(os, oid, osd_obj_tag, dbp);
00278         if (rc)
00279                 return rc;
00280 
00281         dmu_object_info_from_db(*dbp, doi);
00282         if (unlikely (oid != DMU_USERUSED_OBJECT &&
00283             oid != DMU_GROUPUSED_OBJECT && doi->doi_bonus_type != DMU_OT_SA)) {
00284                 sa_buf_rele(*dbp, osd_obj_tag);
00285                 *dbp = NULL;
00286                 return -EINVAL;
00287         }
00288 
00289         LASSERT(*dbp);
00290         LASSERT((*dbp)->db_object == oid);
00291         LASSERT((*dbp)->db_offset == -1);
00292         LASSERT((*dbp)->db_data != NULL);
00293 
00294         return 0;
00295 }
00296 
00297 /*
00298  * Concurrency: no concurrent access is possible that early in object
00299  * life-cycle.
00300  */
00301 struct lu_object *osd_object_alloc(const struct lu_env *env,
00302                                    const struct lu_object_header *hdr,
00303                                    struct lu_device *d)
00304 {
00305         struct osd_object *mo;
00306 
00307         OBD_SLAB_ALLOC_PTR_GFP(mo, osd_object_kmem, GFP_NOFS);
00308         if (mo != NULL) {
00309                 struct lu_object *l;
00310 
00311                 l = &mo->oo_dt.do_lu;
00312                 dt_object_init(&mo->oo_dt, NULL, d);
00313                 mo->oo_dt.do_ops = &osd_obj_ops;
00314                 l->lo_ops = &osd_lu_obj_ops;
00315                 INIT_LIST_HEAD(&mo->oo_sa_linkage);
00316                 INIT_LIST_HEAD(&mo->oo_unlinked_linkage);
00317                 init_rwsem(&mo->oo_sem);
00318                 init_rwsem(&mo->oo_guard);
00319                 rwlock_init(&mo->oo_attr_lock);
00320                 mo->oo_destroy = OSD_DESTROY_NONE;
00321                 return l;
00322         } else {
00323                 return NULL;
00324         }
00325 }
00326 
00327 /*
00328  * Concurrency: shouldn't matter.
00329  */
00330 int osd_object_init0(const struct lu_env *env, struct osd_object *obj)
00331 {
00332         struct osd_device       *osd = osd_obj2dev(obj);
00333         const struct lu_fid     *fid = lu_object_fid(&obj->oo_dt.do_lu);
00334         int                      rc = 0;
00335         ENTRY;
00336 
00337         if (obj->oo_db == NULL)
00338                 RETURN(0);
00339 
00340         /* object exist */
00341 
00342         rc = osd_object_sa_init(obj, osd);
00343         if (rc)
00344                 RETURN(rc);
00345 
00346         /* cache attrs in object */
00347         rc = __osd_object_attr_get(env, osd, obj, &obj->oo_attr);
00348         if (rc)
00349                 RETURN(rc);
00350 
00351         if (likely(!fid_is_acct(fid)))
00352                 /* no body operations for accounting objects */
00353                 obj->oo_dt.do_body_ops = &osd_body_ops;
00354 
00355         /*
00356          * initialize object before marking it existing
00357          */
00358         obj->oo_dt.do_lu.lo_header->loh_attr |= obj->oo_attr.la_mode & S_IFMT;
00359 
00360         smp_mb();
00361         obj->oo_dt.do_lu.lo_header->loh_attr |= LOHA_EXISTS;
00362 
00363         RETURN(0);
00364 }
00365 
00366 static int osd_check_lma(const struct lu_env *env, struct osd_object *obj)
00367 {
00368         struct osd_thread_info  *info = osd_oti_get(env);
00369         struct lu_buf           buf;
00370         int                     rc;
00371         struct lustre_mdt_attrs *lma;
00372         ENTRY;
00373 
00374         CLASSERT(sizeof(info->oti_buf) >= sizeof(*lma));
00375         lma = (struct lustre_mdt_attrs *)info->oti_buf;
00376         buf.lb_buf = lma;
00377         buf.lb_len = sizeof(info->oti_buf);
00378 
00379         rc = osd_xattr_get(env, &obj->oo_dt, &buf, XATTR_NAME_LMA);
00380         if (rc > 0) {
00381                 rc = 0;
00382                 lustre_lma_swab(lma);
00383                 if (unlikely((lma->lma_incompat & ~LMA_INCOMPAT_SUPP) ||
00384                              CFS_FAIL_CHECK(OBD_FAIL_OSD_LMA_INCOMPAT))) {
00385                         CWARN("%s: unsupported incompat LMA feature(s) %#x for "
00386                               "fid = "DFID"\n", osd_obj2dev(obj)->od_svname,
00387                               lma->lma_incompat & ~LMA_INCOMPAT_SUPP,
00388                               PFID(lu_object_fid(&obj->oo_dt.do_lu)));
00389                         rc = -EOPNOTSUPP;
00390                 }
00391         } else if (rc == -ENODATA) {
00392                 /* haven't initialize LMA xattr */
00393                 rc = 0;
00394         }
00395 
00396         RETURN(rc);
00397 }
00398 
00399 /*
00400  * Concurrency: no concurrent access is possible that early in object
00401  * life-cycle.
00402  */
00403 static int osd_object_init(const struct lu_env *env, struct lu_object *l,
00404                            const struct lu_object_conf *conf)
00405 {
00406         struct osd_object       *obj = osd_obj(l);
00407         struct osd_device       *osd = osd_obj2dev(obj);
00408         uint64_t                 oid;
00409         int                      rc;
00410         ENTRY;
00411 
00412         LASSERT(osd_invariant(obj));
00413 
00414         if (fid_is_otable_it(&l->lo_header->loh_fid)) {
00415                 obj->oo_dt.do_ops = &osd_obj_otable_it_ops;
00416                 l->lo_header->loh_attr |= LOHA_EXISTS;
00417                 RETURN(0);
00418         }
00419 
00420         if (conf != NULL && conf->loc_flags & LOC_F_NEW)
00421                 GOTO(out, rc = 0);
00422 
00423         rc = osd_fid_lookup(env, osd, lu_object_fid(l), &oid);
00424         if (rc == 0) {
00425                 LASSERT(obj->oo_db == NULL);
00426                 rc = __osd_obj2dbuf(env, osd->od_os, oid, &obj->oo_db);
00427                 /* EEXIST will be returned if object is being deleted in ZFS */
00428                 if (rc == -EEXIST) {
00429                         rc = 0;
00430                         GOTO(out, rc);
00431                 }
00432                 if (rc != 0) {
00433                         CERROR("%s: lookup "DFID"/"LPX64" failed: rc = %d\n",
00434                                osd->od_svname, PFID(lu_object_fid(l)), oid, rc);
00435                         GOTO(out, rc);
00436                 }
00437                 LASSERT(obj->oo_db);
00438                 rc = osd_object_init0(env, obj);
00439                 if (rc != 0)
00440                         GOTO(out, rc);
00441 
00442                 rc = osd_check_lma(env, obj);
00443                 if (rc != 0)
00444                         GOTO(out, rc);
00445         } else if (rc == -ENOENT) {
00446                 rc = 0;
00447         }
00448         LASSERT(osd_invariant(obj));
00449 out:
00450         RETURN(rc);
00451 }
00452 
00453 /*
00454  * Concurrency: no concurrent access is possible that late in object
00455  * life-cycle.
00456  */
00457 static void osd_object_free(const struct lu_env *env, struct lu_object *l)
00458 {
00459         struct osd_object *obj = osd_obj(l);
00460 
00461         LASSERT(osd_invariant(obj));
00462 
00463         dt_object_fini(&obj->oo_dt);
00464         OBD_SLAB_FREE_PTR(obj, osd_object_kmem);
00465 }
00466 
00467 static int
00468 osd_object_unlinked_add(struct osd_object *obj, struct osd_thandle *oh)
00469 {
00470         int rc = -EBUSY;
00471 
00472         LASSERT(obj->oo_destroy == OSD_DESTROY_ASYNC);
00473 
00474         /* the object is supposed to be exclusively locked by
00475          * the caller (osd_object_destroy()), while the transaction
00476          * (oh) is per-thread and not shared */
00477         if (likely(list_empty(&obj->oo_unlinked_linkage))) {
00478                 list_add(&obj->oo_unlinked_linkage, &oh->ot_unlinked_list);
00479                 rc = 0;
00480         }
00481 
00482         return rc;
00483 }
00484 
00485 /* Default to max data size covered by a level-1 indirect block */
00486 static unsigned long osd_sync_destroy_max_size =
00487         1UL << (DN_MAX_INDBLKSHIFT - SPA_BLKPTRSHIFT + SPA_MAXBLOCKSHIFT);
00488 module_param(osd_sync_destroy_max_size, ulong, 0444);
00489 MODULE_PARM_DESC(osd_sync_destroy_max_size, "Maximum object size to use synchronous destroy.");
00490 
00491 static inline void
00492 osd_object_set_destroy_type(struct osd_object *obj)
00493 {
00494         /*
00495          * Lock-less OST_WRITE can race with OST_DESTROY, so set destroy type
00496          * only once and use it consistently thereafter.
00497          */
00498         down_write(&obj->oo_guard);
00499         if (obj->oo_destroy == OSD_DESTROY_NONE) {
00500                 if (obj->oo_attr.la_size <= osd_sync_destroy_max_size)
00501                         obj->oo_destroy = OSD_DESTROY_SYNC;
00502                 else /* Larger objects are destroyed asynchronously */
00503                         obj->oo_destroy = OSD_DESTROY_ASYNC;
00504         }
00505         up_write(&obj->oo_guard);
00506 }
00507 
00508 static int osd_declare_object_destroy(const struct lu_env *env,
00509                                       struct dt_object *dt,
00510                                       struct thandle *th)
00511 {
00512         char                    *buf = osd_oti_get(env)->oti_str;
00513         const struct lu_fid     *fid = lu_object_fid(&dt->do_lu);
00514         struct osd_object       *obj = osd_dt_obj(dt);
00515         struct osd_device       *osd = osd_obj2dev(obj);
00516         struct osd_thandle      *oh;
00517         int                      rc;
00518         uint64_t                 zapid;
00519         ENTRY;
00520 
00521         LASSERT(th != NULL);
00522         LASSERT(dt_object_exists(dt));
00523 
00524         oh = container_of0(th, struct osd_thandle, ot_super);
00525         LASSERT(oh->ot_tx != NULL);
00526 
00527         /* declare that we'll remove object from fid-dnode mapping */
00528         zapid = osd_get_name_n_idx(env, osd, fid, buf);
00529         dmu_tx_hold_bonus(oh->ot_tx, zapid);
00530         dmu_tx_hold_zap(oh->ot_tx, zapid, FALSE, buf);
00531 
00532         osd_declare_xattrs_destroy(env, obj, oh);
00533 
00534         /* declare that we'll remove object from inode accounting ZAPs */
00535         dmu_tx_hold_bonus(oh->ot_tx, osd->od_iusr_oid);
00536         dmu_tx_hold_zap(oh->ot_tx, osd->od_iusr_oid, FALSE, buf);
00537         dmu_tx_hold_bonus(oh->ot_tx, osd->od_igrp_oid);
00538         dmu_tx_hold_zap(oh->ot_tx, osd->od_igrp_oid, FALSE, buf);
00539 
00540         /* one less inode */
00541         rc = osd_declare_quota(env, osd, obj->oo_attr.la_uid,
00542                                obj->oo_attr.la_gid, -1, oh, false, NULL, false);
00543         if (rc)
00544                 RETURN(rc);
00545 
00546         /* data to be truncated */
00547         rc = osd_declare_quota(env, osd, obj->oo_attr.la_uid,
00548                                obj->oo_attr.la_gid, 0, oh, true, NULL, false);
00549         if (rc)
00550                 RETURN(rc);
00551 
00552         osd_object_set_destroy_type(obj);
00553         if (obj->oo_destroy == OSD_DESTROY_SYNC)
00554                 dmu_tx_hold_free(oh->ot_tx, obj->oo_db->db_object,
00555                                  0, DMU_OBJECT_END);
00556         else
00557                 dmu_tx_hold_zap(oh->ot_tx, osd->od_unlinkedid, TRUE, NULL);
00558 
00559         RETURN(0);
00560 }
00561 
00562 static int osd_object_destroy(const struct lu_env *env,
00563                               struct dt_object *dt, struct thandle *th)
00564 {
00565         char                    *buf = osd_oti_get(env)->oti_str;
00566         struct osd_object       *obj = osd_dt_obj(dt);
00567         struct osd_device       *osd = osd_obj2dev(obj);
00568         const struct lu_fid     *fid = lu_object_fid(&dt->do_lu);
00569         struct osd_thandle      *oh;
00570         int                      rc;
00571         uint64_t                 oid, zapid;
00572         ENTRY;
00573 
00574         down_write(&obj->oo_guard);
00575 
00576         if (unlikely(!dt_object_exists(dt) || obj->oo_destroyed))
00577                 GOTO(out, rc = -ENOENT);
00578 
00579         LASSERT(obj->oo_db != NULL);
00580 
00581         oh = container_of0(th, struct osd_thandle, ot_super);
00582         LASSERT(oh != NULL);
00583         LASSERT(oh->ot_tx != NULL);
00584 
00585         /* remove obj ref from index dir (it depends) */
00586         zapid = osd_get_name_n_idx(env, osd, fid, buf);
00587         rc = -zap_remove(osd->od_os, zapid, buf, oh->ot_tx);
00588         if (rc) {
00589                 CERROR("%s: zap_remove(%s) failed: rc = %d\n",
00590                        osd->od_svname, buf, rc);
00591                 GOTO(out, rc);
00592         }
00593 
00594         rc = osd_xattrs_destroy(env, obj, oh);
00595         if (rc) {
00596                 CERROR("%s: cannot destroy xattrs for %s: rc = %d\n",
00597                        osd->od_svname, buf, rc);
00598                 GOTO(out, rc);
00599         }
00600 
00601         /* Remove object from inode accounting. It is not fatal for the destroy
00602          * operation if something goes wrong while updating accounting, but we
00603          * still log an error message to notify the administrator */
00604         rc = -zap_increment_int(osd->od_os, osd->od_iusr_oid,
00605                                 obj->oo_attr.la_uid, -1, oh->ot_tx);
00606         if (rc)
00607                 CERROR("%s: failed to remove "DFID" from accounting ZAP for usr"
00608                        " %d: rc = %d\n", osd->od_svname, PFID(fid),
00609                        obj->oo_attr.la_uid, rc);
00610         rc = -zap_increment_int(osd->od_os, osd->od_igrp_oid,
00611                                 obj->oo_attr.la_gid, -1, oh->ot_tx);
00612         if (rc)
00613                 CERROR("%s: failed to remove "DFID" from accounting ZAP for grp"
00614                        " %d: rc = %d\n", osd->od_svname, PFID(fid),
00615                        obj->oo_attr.la_gid, rc);
00616 
00617         oid = obj->oo_db->db_object;
00618         if (unlikely(obj->oo_destroy == OSD_DESTROY_NONE)) {
00619                 /* this may happen if the destroy wasn't declared
00620                  * e.g. when the object is created and then destroyed
00621                  * in the same transaction - we don't need additional
00622                  * space for destroy specifically */
00623                 LASSERT(obj->oo_attr.la_size <= osd_sync_destroy_max_size);
00624                 rc = -dmu_object_free(osd->od_os, oid, oh->ot_tx);
00625                 if (rc)
00626                         CERROR("%s: failed to free %s "LPU64": rc = %d\n",
00627                                osd->od_svname, buf, oid, rc);
00628         } else if (obj->oo_destroy == OSD_DESTROY_SYNC) {
00629                 rc = -dmu_object_free(osd->od_os, oid, oh->ot_tx);
00630                 if (rc)
00631                         CERROR("%s: failed to free %s "LPU64": rc = %d\n",
00632                                osd->od_svname, buf, oid, rc);
00633         } else { /* asynchronous destroy */
00634                 rc = osd_object_unlinked_add(obj, oh);
00635                 if (rc)
00636                         GOTO(out, rc);
00637 
00638                 rc = -zap_add_int(osd->od_os, osd->od_unlinkedid,
00639                                   oid, oh->ot_tx);
00640                 if (rc)
00641                         CERROR("%s: zap_add_int() failed %s "LPU64": rc = %d\n",
00642                                osd->od_svname, buf, oid, rc);
00643         }
00644 
00645 out:
00646         /* not needed in the cache anymore */
00647         set_bit(LU_OBJECT_HEARD_BANSHEE, &dt->do_lu.lo_header->loh_flags);
00648         if (rc == 0)
00649                 obj->oo_destroyed = 1;
00650         up_write(&obj->oo_guard);
00651         RETURN (0);
00652 }
00653 
00654 static void osd_object_delete(const struct lu_env *env, struct lu_object *l)
00655 {
00656         struct osd_object *obj = osd_obj(l);
00657 
00658         if (obj->oo_db != NULL) {
00659                 osd_object_sa_fini(obj);
00660                 if (obj->oo_sa_xattr) {
00661                         nvlist_free(obj->oo_sa_xattr);
00662                         obj->oo_sa_xattr = NULL;
00663                 }
00664                 sa_buf_rele(obj->oo_db, osd_obj_tag);
00665                 list_del(&obj->oo_sa_linkage);
00666                 obj->oo_db = NULL;
00667         }
00668 }
00669 
00670 /*
00671  * Concurrency: ->loo_object_release() is called under site spin-lock.
00672  */
00673 static void osd_object_release(const struct lu_env *env,
00674                                struct lu_object *l)
00675 {
00676 }
00677 
00678 /*
00679  * Concurrency: shouldn't matter.
00680  */
00681 static int osd_object_print(const struct lu_env *env, void *cookie,
00682                             lu_printer_t p, const struct lu_object *l)
00683 {
00684         struct osd_object *o = osd_obj(l);
00685 
00686         return (*p)(env, cookie, LUSTRE_OSD_ZFS_NAME"-object@%p", o);
00687 }
00688 
00689 static void osd_object_read_lock(const struct lu_env *env,
00690                                  struct dt_object *dt, unsigned role)
00691 {
00692         struct osd_object *obj = osd_dt_obj(dt);
00693 
00694         LASSERT(osd_invariant(obj));
00695 
00696         down_read_nested(&obj->oo_sem, role);
00697 }
00698 
00699 static void osd_object_write_lock(const struct lu_env *env,
00700                                   struct dt_object *dt, unsigned role)
00701 {
00702         struct osd_object *obj = osd_dt_obj(dt);
00703 
00704         LASSERT(osd_invariant(obj));
00705 
00706         down_write_nested(&obj->oo_sem, role);
00707 }
00708 
00709 static void osd_object_read_unlock(const struct lu_env *env,
00710                                    struct dt_object *dt)
00711 {
00712         struct osd_object *obj = osd_dt_obj(dt);
00713 
00714         LASSERT(osd_invariant(obj));
00715         up_read(&obj->oo_sem);
00716 }
00717 
00718 static void osd_object_write_unlock(const struct lu_env *env,
00719                                     struct dt_object *dt)
00720 {
00721         struct osd_object *obj = osd_dt_obj(dt);
00722 
00723         LASSERT(osd_invariant(obj));
00724         up_write(&obj->oo_sem);
00725 }
00726 
00727 static int osd_object_write_locked(const struct lu_env *env,
00728                                    struct dt_object *dt)
00729 {
00730         struct osd_object *obj = osd_dt_obj(dt);
00731         int rc = 1;
00732 
00733         LASSERT(osd_invariant(obj));
00734 
00735         if (down_write_trylock(&obj->oo_sem)) {
00736                 rc = 0;
00737                 up_write(&obj->oo_sem);
00738         }
00739         return rc;
00740 }
00741 
00742 static int osd_attr_get(const struct lu_env *env,
00743                         struct dt_object *dt,
00744                         struct lu_attr *attr)
00745 {
00746         struct osd_object       *obj = osd_dt_obj(dt);
00747         uint64_t                 blocks;
00748         uint32_t                 blksize;
00749         int                      rc = 0;
00750 
00751         down_read(&obj->oo_guard);
00752 
00753         if (unlikely(!dt_object_exists(dt) || obj->oo_destroyed))
00754                 GOTO(out, rc = -ENOENT);
00755 
00756         LASSERT(osd_invariant(obj));
00757         LASSERT(obj->oo_db);
00758 
00759         read_lock(&obj->oo_attr_lock);
00760         *attr = obj->oo_attr;
00761         if (obj->oo_lma_flags & LUSTRE_ORPHAN_FL)
00762                 attr->la_flags |= LUSTRE_ORPHAN_FL;
00763         read_unlock(&obj->oo_attr_lock);
00764 
00765         /* with ZFS_DEBUG zrl_add_debug() called by DB_DNODE_ENTER()
00766          * from within sa_object_size() can block on a mutex, so
00767          * we can't call sa_object_size() holding rwlock */
00768         sa_object_size(obj->oo_sa_hdl, &blksize, &blocks);
00769         /* we do not control size of indices, so always calculate
00770          * it from number of blocks reported by DMU */
00771         if (S_ISDIR(attr->la_mode))
00772                 attr->la_size = 512 * blocks;
00773         /* Block size may be not set; suggest maximal I/O transfers. */
00774         if (blksize == 0)
00775                 blksize = osd_spa_maxblocksize(
00776                         dmu_objset_spa(osd_obj2dev(obj)->od_os));
00777 
00778         attr->la_blksize = blksize;
00779         attr->la_blocks = blocks;
00780         attr->la_valid |= LA_BLOCKS | LA_BLKSIZE;
00781 
00782 out:
00783         up_read(&obj->oo_guard);
00784         return rc;
00785 }
00786 
00787 /* Simple wrapper on top of qsd API which implement quota transfer for osd
00788  * setattr needs. As a reminder, only the root user can change ownership of
00789  * a file, that's why EDQUOT & EINPROGRESS errors are discarded */
00790 static inline int qsd_transfer(const struct lu_env *env,
00791                                struct qsd_instance *qsd,
00792                                struct lquota_trans *trans, int qtype,
00793                                __u64 orig_id, __u64 new_id, __u64 bspace,
00794                                struct lquota_id_info *qi)
00795 {
00796         int     rc;
00797 
00798         if (unlikely(qsd == NULL))
00799                 return 0;
00800 
00801         LASSERT(qtype >= 0 && qtype < MAXQUOTAS);
00802         qi->lqi_type = qtype;
00803 
00804         /* inode accounting */
00805         qi->lqi_is_blk = false;
00806 
00807         /* one more inode for the new owner ... */
00808         qi->lqi_id.qid_uid = new_id;
00809         qi->lqi_space      = 1;
00810         rc = qsd_op_begin(env, qsd, trans, qi, NULL);
00811         if (rc == -EDQUOT || rc == -EINPROGRESS)
00812                 rc = 0;
00813         if (rc)
00814                 return rc;
00815 
00816         /* and one less inode for the current id */
00817         qi->lqi_id.qid_uid = orig_id;;
00818         qi->lqi_space      = -1;
00819         /* can't get EDQUOT when reducing usage */
00820         rc = qsd_op_begin(env, qsd, trans, qi, NULL);
00821         if (rc == -EINPROGRESS)
00822                 rc = 0;
00823         if (rc)
00824                 return rc;
00825 
00826         /* block accounting */
00827         qi->lqi_is_blk = true;
00828 
00829         /* more blocks for the new owner ... */
00830         qi->lqi_id.qid_uid = new_id;
00831         qi->lqi_space      = bspace;
00832         rc = qsd_op_begin(env, qsd, trans, qi, NULL);
00833         if (rc == -EDQUOT || rc == -EINPROGRESS)
00834                 rc = 0;
00835         if (rc)
00836                 return rc;
00837 
00838         /* and finally less blocks for the current owner */
00839         qi->lqi_id.qid_uid = orig_id;
00840         qi->lqi_space      = -bspace;
00841         rc = qsd_op_begin(env, qsd, trans, qi, NULL);
00842         /* can't get EDQUOT when reducing usage */
00843         if (rc == -EINPROGRESS)
00844                 rc = 0;
00845         return rc;
00846 }
00847 
00848 static int osd_declare_attr_set(const struct lu_env *env,
00849                                 struct dt_object *dt,
00850                                 const struct lu_attr *attr,
00851                                 struct thandle *handle)
00852 {
00853         struct osd_thread_info  *info = osd_oti_get(env);
00854         char                    *buf = osd_oti_get(env)->oti_str;
00855         struct osd_object       *obj = osd_dt_obj(dt);
00856         struct osd_device       *osd = osd_obj2dev(obj);
00857         struct osd_thandle      *oh;
00858         uint64_t                 bspace;
00859         uint32_t                 blksize;
00860         int                      rc = 0;
00861         ENTRY;
00862 
00863 
00864         LASSERT(handle != NULL);
00865         LASSERT(osd_invariant(obj));
00866 
00867         oh = container_of0(handle, struct osd_thandle, ot_super);
00868 
00869         down_read(&obj->oo_guard);
00870         if (unlikely(!dt_object_exists(dt) || obj->oo_destroyed))
00871                 GOTO(out, rc = 0);
00872 
00873         LASSERT(obj->oo_sa_hdl != NULL);
00874         LASSERT(oh->ot_tx != NULL);
00875         dmu_tx_hold_sa(oh->ot_tx, obj->oo_sa_hdl, 0);
00876         if (oh->ot_tx->tx_err != 0)
00877                 GOTO(out, rc = -oh->ot_tx->tx_err);
00878 
00879         sa_object_size(obj->oo_sa_hdl, &blksize, &bspace);
00880         bspace = toqb(bspace * blksize);
00881 
00882         __osd_xattr_declare_set(env, obj, sizeof(struct lustre_mdt_attrs),
00883                                 XATTR_NAME_LMA, oh);
00884 
00885         if (attr && attr->la_valid & LA_UID) {
00886                 /* account for user inode tracking ZAP update */
00887                 dmu_tx_hold_bonus(oh->ot_tx, osd->od_iusr_oid);
00888                 dmu_tx_hold_zap(oh->ot_tx, osd->od_iusr_oid, TRUE, buf);
00889 
00890                 /* quota enforcement for user */
00891                 if (attr->la_uid != obj->oo_attr.la_uid) {
00892                         rc = qsd_transfer(env, osd->od_quota_slave,
00893                                           &oh->ot_quota_trans, USRQUOTA,
00894                                           obj->oo_attr.la_uid, attr->la_uid,
00895                                           bspace, &info->oti_qi);
00896                         if (rc)
00897                                 GOTO(out, rc);
00898                 }
00899         }
00900         if (attr && attr->la_valid & LA_GID) {
00901                 /* account for user inode tracking ZAP update */
00902                 dmu_tx_hold_bonus(oh->ot_tx, osd->od_igrp_oid);
00903                 dmu_tx_hold_zap(oh->ot_tx, osd->od_igrp_oid, TRUE, buf);
00904 
00905                 /* quota enforcement for group */
00906                 if (attr->la_gid != obj->oo_attr.la_gid) {
00907                         rc = qsd_transfer(env, osd->od_quota_slave,
00908                                           &oh->ot_quota_trans, GRPQUOTA,
00909                                           obj->oo_attr.la_gid, attr->la_gid,
00910                                           bspace, &info->oti_qi);
00911                         if (rc)
00912                                 GOTO(out, rc);
00913                 }
00914         }
00915 
00916 out:
00917         up_read(&obj->oo_guard);
00918         RETURN(rc);
00919 }
00920 
00921 /*
00922  * Set the attributes of an object
00923  *
00924  * The transaction passed to this routine must have
00925  * dmu_tx_hold_bonus(tx, oid) called and then assigned
00926  * to a transaction group.
00927  */
00928 static int osd_attr_set(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_object *dt,
00929                         const struct lu_attr *la, struct thandle *handle)
00930 {
00931         struct osd_thread_info  *info = osd_oti_get(env);
00932         struct osd_object       *obj = osd_dt_obj(dt);
00933         struct osd_device       *osd = osd_obj2dev(obj);
00934         struct osd_thandle      *oh;
00935         struct osa_attr         *osa = &info->oti_osa;
00936         sa_bulk_attr_t          *bulk;
00937         __u64                    valid = la->la_valid;
00938         int                      cnt;
00939         int                      rc = 0;
00940 
00941         ENTRY;
00942 
00943         down_read(&obj->oo_guard);
00944         if (unlikely(!dt_object_exists(dt) || obj->oo_destroyed))
00945                 GOTO(out, rc = -ENOENT);
00946 
00947         LASSERT(handle != NULL);
00948         LASSERT(osd_invariant(obj));
00949         LASSERT(obj->oo_sa_hdl);
00950 
00951         oh = container_of0(handle, struct osd_thandle, ot_super);
00952         /* Assert that the transaction has been assigned to a
00953            transaction group. */
00954         LASSERT(oh->ot_tx->tx_txg != 0);
00955 
00956         /* Only allow set size for regular file */
00957         if (!S_ISREG(dt->do_lu.lo_header->loh_attr))
00958                 valid &= ~(LA_SIZE | LA_BLOCKS);
00959 
00960         if (valid & LA_CTIME && la->la_ctime == obj->oo_attr.la_ctime)
00961                 valid &= ~LA_CTIME;
00962 
00963         if (valid & LA_MTIME && la->la_mtime == obj->oo_attr.la_mtime)
00964                 valid &= ~LA_MTIME;
00965 
00966         if (valid & LA_ATIME && la->la_atime == obj->oo_attr.la_atime)
00967                 valid &= ~LA_ATIME;
00968 
00969         if (valid == 0)
00970                 GOTO(out, rc = 0);
00971 
00972         if (valid & LA_FLAGS) {
00973                 struct lustre_mdt_attrs *lma;
00974                 struct lu_buf buf;
00975 
00976                 if (la->la_flags & LUSTRE_LMA_FL_MASKS) {
00977                         CLASSERT(sizeof(info->oti_buf) >= sizeof(*lma));
00978                         lma = (struct lustre_mdt_attrs *)&info->oti_buf;
00979                         buf.lb_buf = lma;
00980                         buf.lb_len = sizeof(info->oti_buf);
00981                         rc = osd_xattr_get(env, &obj->oo_dt, &buf,
00982                                            XATTR_NAME_LMA);
00983                         if (rc > 0) {
00984                                 lma->lma_incompat =
00985                                         le32_to_cpu(lma->lma_incompat);
00986                                 lma->lma_incompat |=
00987                                         lustre_to_lma_flags(la->la_flags);
00988                                 lma->lma_incompat =
00989                                         cpu_to_le32(lma->lma_incompat);
00990                                 buf.lb_buf = lma;
00991                                 buf.lb_len = sizeof(*lma);
00992                                 rc = osd_xattr_set_internal(env, obj, &buf,
00993                                                             XATTR_NAME_LMA,
00994                                                             LU_XATTR_REPLACE,
00995                                                             oh);
00996                         }
00997                         if (rc < 0) {
00998                                 CWARN("%s: failed to set LMA flags: rc = %d\n",
00999                                        osd->od_svname, rc);
01000                                 RETURN(rc);
01001                         }
01002                 }
01003         }
01004 
01005         OBD_ALLOC(bulk, sizeof(sa_bulk_attr_t) * 10);
01006         if (bulk == NULL)
01007                 GOTO(out, rc = -ENOMEM);
01008 
01009         /* do both accounting updates outside oo_attr_lock below */
01010         if ((valid & LA_UID) && (la->la_uid != obj->oo_attr.la_uid)) {
01011                 /* Update user accounting. Failure isn't fatal, but we still
01012                  * log an error message */
01013                 rc = -zap_increment_int(osd->od_os, osd->od_iusr_oid,
01014                                         la->la_uid, 1, oh->ot_tx);
01015                 if (rc)
01016                         CERROR("%s: failed to update accounting ZAP for user "
01017                                 "%d (%d)\n", osd->od_svname, la->la_uid, rc);
01018                 rc = -zap_increment_int(osd->od_os, osd->od_iusr_oid,
01019                                         obj->oo_attr.la_uid, -1, oh->ot_tx);
01020                 if (rc)
01021                         CERROR("%s: failed to update accounting ZAP for user "
01022                                 "%d (%d)\n", osd->od_svname,
01023                                 obj->oo_attr.la_uid, rc);
01024         }
01025         if ((valid & LA_GID) && (la->la_gid != obj->oo_attr.la_gid)) {
01026                 /* Update group accounting. Failure isn't fatal, but we still
01027                  * log an error message */
01028                 rc = -zap_increment_int(osd->od_os, osd->od_igrp_oid,
01029                                         la->la_gid, 1, oh->ot_tx);
01030                 if (rc)
01031                         CERROR("%s: failed to update accounting ZAP for user "
01032                                 "%d (%d)\n", osd->od_svname, la->la_gid, rc);
01033                 rc = -zap_increment_int(osd->od_os, osd->od_igrp_oid,
01034                                         obj->oo_attr.la_gid, -1, oh->ot_tx);
01035                 if (rc)
01036                         CERROR("%s: failed to update accounting ZAP for user "
01037                                 "%d (%d)\n", osd->od_svname,
01038                                 obj->oo_attr.la_gid, rc);
01039         }
01040 
01041         write_lock(&obj->oo_attr_lock);
01042         cnt = 0;
01043         if (valid & LA_ATIME) {
01044                 osa->atime[0] = obj->oo_attr.la_atime = la->la_atime;
01045                 SA_ADD_BULK_ATTR(bulk, cnt, SA_ZPL_ATIME(osd), NULL,
01046                                  osa->atime, 16);
01047         }
01048         if (valid & LA_MTIME) {
01049                 osa->mtime[0] = obj->oo_attr.la_mtime = la->la_mtime;
01050                 SA_ADD_BULK_ATTR(bulk, cnt, SA_ZPL_MTIME(osd), NULL,
01051                                  osa->mtime, 16);
01052         }
01053         if (valid & LA_CTIME) {
01054                 osa->ctime[0] = obj->oo_attr.la_ctime = la->la_ctime;
01055                 SA_ADD_BULK_ATTR(bulk, cnt, SA_ZPL_CTIME(osd), NULL,
01056                                  osa->ctime, 16);
01057         }
01058         if (valid & LA_MODE) {
01059                 /* mode is stored along with type, so read it first */
01060                 obj->oo_attr.la_mode = (obj->oo_attr.la_mode & S_IFMT) |
01061                         (la->la_mode & ~S_IFMT);
01062                 osa->mode = obj->oo_attr.la_mode;
01063                 SA_ADD_BULK_ATTR(bulk, cnt, SA_ZPL_MODE(osd), NULL,
01064                                  &osa->mode, 8);
01065         }
01066         if (valid & LA_SIZE) {
01067                 osa->size = obj->oo_attr.la_size = la->la_size;
01068                 SA_ADD_BULK_ATTR(bulk, cnt, SA_ZPL_SIZE(osd), NULL,
01069                                  &osa->size, 8);
01070         }
01071         if (valid & LA_NLINK) {
01072                 osa->nlink = obj->oo_attr.la_nlink = la->la_nlink;
01073                 SA_ADD_BULK_ATTR(bulk, cnt, SA_ZPL_LINKS(osd), NULL,
01074                                  &osa->nlink, 8);
01075         }
01076         if (valid & LA_RDEV) {
01077                 osa->rdev = obj->oo_attr.la_rdev = la->la_rdev;
01078                 SA_ADD_BULK_ATTR(bulk, cnt, SA_ZPL_RDEV(osd), NULL,
01079                                  &osa->rdev, 8);
01080         }
01081         if (valid & LA_FLAGS) {
01082                 osa->flags = attrs_fs2zfs(la->la_flags);
01083                 /* many flags are not supported by zfs, so ensure a good cached
01084                  * copy */
01085                 obj->oo_attr.la_flags = attrs_zfs2fs(osa->flags);
01086                 SA_ADD_BULK_ATTR(bulk, cnt, SA_ZPL_FLAGS(osd), NULL,
01087                                  &osa->flags, 8);
01088         }
01089         if (valid & LA_UID) {
01090                 osa->uid = obj->oo_attr.la_uid = la->la_uid;
01091                 SA_ADD_BULK_ATTR(bulk, cnt, SA_ZPL_UID(osd), NULL,
01092                                  &osa->uid, 8);
01093         }
01094         if (valid & LA_GID) {
01095                 osa->gid = obj->oo_attr.la_gid = la->la_gid;
01096                 SA_ADD_BULK_ATTR(bulk, cnt, SA_ZPL_GID(osd), NULL,
01097                                  &osa->gid, 8);
01098         }
01099         obj->oo_attr.la_valid |= valid;
01100         write_unlock(&obj->oo_attr_lock);
01101 
01102         rc = osd_object_sa_bulk_update(obj, bulk, cnt, oh);
01103 
01104         OBD_FREE(bulk, sizeof(sa_bulk_attr_t) * 10);
01105 out:
01106         up_read(&obj->oo_guard);
01107         RETURN(rc);
01108 }
01109 
01110 /*
01111  * Object creation.
01112  *
01113  * XXX temporary solution.
01114  */
01115 
01116 static void osd_ah_init(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_allocation_hint *ah,
01117                         struct dt_object *parent, struct dt_object *child,
01118                         umode_t child_mode)
01119 {
01120         LASSERT(ah);
01121 
01122         ah->dah_parent = parent;
01123         ah->dah_mode = child_mode;
01124 }
01125 
01126 static int osd_declare_object_create(const struct lu_env *env,
01127                                      struct dt_object *dt,
01128                                      struct lu_attr *attr,
01129                                      struct dt_allocation_hint *hint,
01130                                      struct dt_object_format *dof,
01131                                      struct thandle *handle)
01132 {
01133         char                    *buf = osd_oti_get(env)->oti_str;
01134         const struct lu_fid     *fid = lu_object_fid(&dt->do_lu);
01135         struct osd_object       *obj = osd_dt_obj(dt);
01136         struct osd_device       *osd = osd_obj2dev(obj);
01137         struct osd_thandle      *oh;
01138         uint64_t                 zapid;
01139         int                      rc;
01140         ENTRY;
01141 
01142         LASSERT(dof);
01143 
01144         switch (dof->dof_type) {
01145                 case DFT_REGULAR:
01146                 case DFT_SYM:
01147                 case DFT_NODE:
01148                         if (obj->oo_dt.do_body_ops == NULL)
01149                                 obj->oo_dt.do_body_ops = &osd_body_ops;
01150                         break;
01151                 default:
01152                         break;
01153         }
01154 
01155         LASSERT(handle != NULL);
01156         oh = container_of0(handle, struct osd_thandle, ot_super);
01157         LASSERT(oh->ot_tx != NULL);
01158 
01159         switch (dof->dof_type) {
01160                 case DFT_DIR:
01161                         dt->do_index_ops = &osd_dir_ops;
01162                 case DFT_INDEX:
01163                         /* for zap create */
01164                         dmu_tx_hold_zap(oh->ot_tx, DMU_NEW_OBJECT, 1, NULL);
01165                         break;
01166                 case DFT_REGULAR:
01167                 case DFT_SYM:
01168                 case DFT_NODE:
01169                         /* first, we'll create new object */
01170                         dmu_tx_hold_bonus(oh->ot_tx, DMU_NEW_OBJECT);
01171                         break;
01172 
01173                 default:
01174                         LBUG();
01175                         break;
01176         }
01177 
01178         /* and we'll add it to some mapping */
01179         zapid = osd_get_name_n_idx(env, osd, fid, buf);
01180         dmu_tx_hold_bonus(oh->ot_tx, zapid);
01181         dmu_tx_hold_zap(oh->ot_tx, zapid, TRUE, buf);
01182 
01183         /* we will also update inode accounting ZAPs */
01184         dmu_tx_hold_bonus(oh->ot_tx, osd->od_iusr_oid);
01185         dmu_tx_hold_zap(oh->ot_tx, osd->od_iusr_oid, TRUE, buf);
01186         dmu_tx_hold_bonus(oh->ot_tx, osd->od_igrp_oid);
01187         dmu_tx_hold_zap(oh->ot_tx, osd->od_igrp_oid, TRUE, buf);
01188 
01189         dmu_tx_hold_sa_create(oh->ot_tx, ZFS_SA_BASE_ATTR_SIZE);
01190 
01191         __osd_xattr_declare_set(env, obj, sizeof(struct lustre_mdt_attrs),
01192                                 XATTR_NAME_LMA, oh);
01193 
01194         rc = osd_declare_quota(env, osd, attr->la_uid, attr->la_gid, 1, oh,
01195                                false, NULL, false);
01196         RETURN(rc);
01197 }
01198 
01199 int __osd_attr_init(const struct lu_env *env, struct osd_device *osd,
01200                     uint64_t oid, dmu_tx_t *tx, struct lu_attr *la,
01201                     uint64_t parent)
01202 {
01203         sa_bulk_attr_t  *bulk;
01204         sa_handle_t     *sa_hdl;
01205         struct osa_attr *osa = &osd_oti_get(env)->oti_osa;
01206         uint64_t         gen;
01207         uint64_t         crtime[2];
01208         timestruc_t      now;
01209         int              cnt;
01210         int              rc;
01211 
01212         gethrestime(&now);
01213         gen = dmu_tx_get_txg(tx);
01214 
01215         ZFS_TIME_ENCODE(&now, crtime);
01216 
01217         osa->atime[0] = la->la_atime;
01218         osa->ctime[0] = la->la_ctime;
01219         osa->mtime[0] = la->la_mtime;
01220         osa->mode = la->la_mode;
01221         osa->uid = la->la_uid;
01222         osa->gid = la->la_gid;
01223         osa->rdev = la->la_rdev;
01224         osa->nlink = la->la_nlink;
01225         osa->flags = attrs_fs2zfs(la->la_flags);
01226         osa->size  = la->la_size;
01227 
01228         /* Now add in all of the "SA" attributes */
01229         rc = -sa_handle_get(osd->od_os, oid, NULL, SA_HDL_PRIVATE, &sa_hdl);
01230         if (rc)
01231                 return rc;
01232 
01233         OBD_ALLOC(bulk, sizeof(sa_bulk_attr_t) * 13);
01234         if (bulk == NULL) {
01235                 rc = -ENOMEM;
01236                 goto out;
01237         }
01238         /*
01239          * we need to create all SA below upon object create.
01240          *
01241          * XXX The attribute order matters since the accounting callback relies
01242          * on static offsets (i.e. SA_*_OFFSET, see zfs_space_delta_cb()) to
01243          * look up the UID/GID attributes. Moreover, the callback does not seem
01244          * to support the spill block.
01245          * We define attributes in the same order as SA_*_OFFSET in order to
01246          * work around the problem. See ORI-610.
01247          */
01248         cnt = 0;
01249         SA_ADD_BULK_ATTR(bulk, cnt, SA_ZPL_MODE(osd), NULL, &osa->mode, 8);
01250         SA_ADD_BULK_ATTR(bulk, cnt, SA_ZPL_SIZE(osd), NULL, &osa->size, 8);
01251         SA_ADD_BULK_ATTR(bulk, cnt, SA_ZPL_GEN(osd), NULL, &gen, 8);
01252         SA_ADD_BULK_ATTR(bulk, cnt, SA_ZPL_UID(osd), NULL, &osa->uid, 8);
01253         SA_ADD_BULK_ATTR(bulk, cnt, SA_ZPL_GID(osd), NULL, &osa->gid, 8);
01254         SA_ADD_BULK_ATTR(bulk, cnt, SA_ZPL_PARENT(osd), NULL, &parent, 8);
01255         SA_ADD_BULK_ATTR(bulk, cnt, SA_ZPL_FLAGS(osd), NULL, &osa->flags, 8);
01256         SA_ADD_BULK_ATTR(bulk, cnt, SA_ZPL_ATIME(osd), NULL, osa->atime, 16);
01257         SA_ADD_BULK_ATTR(bulk, cnt, SA_ZPL_MTIME(osd), NULL, osa->mtime, 16);
01258         SA_ADD_BULK_ATTR(bulk, cnt, SA_ZPL_CTIME(osd), NULL, osa->ctime, 16);
01259         SA_ADD_BULK_ATTR(bulk, cnt, SA_ZPL_CRTIME(osd), NULL, crtime, 16);
01260         SA_ADD_BULK_ATTR(bulk, cnt, SA_ZPL_LINKS(osd), NULL, &osa->nlink, 8);
01261         SA_ADD_BULK_ATTR(bulk, cnt, SA_ZPL_RDEV(osd), NULL, &osa->rdev, 8);
01262 
01263         rc = -sa_replace_all_by_template(sa_hdl, bulk, cnt, tx);
01264 
01265         OBD_FREE(bulk, sizeof(sa_bulk_attr_t) * 13);
01266 out:
01267         sa_handle_destroy(sa_hdl);
01268         return rc;
01269 }
01270 
01271 /*
01272  * The transaction passed to this routine must have
01273  * dmu_tx_hold_bonus(tx, DMU_NEW_OBJECT) called and then assigned
01274  * to a transaction group.
01275  */
01276 int __osd_object_create(const struct lu_env *env, struct osd_object *obj,
01277                         dmu_buf_t **dbp, dmu_tx_t *tx, struct lu_attr *la,
01278                         uint64_t parent)
01279 {
01280         uint64_t             oid;
01281         int                  rc;
01282         struct osd_device   *osd = osd_obj2dev(obj);
01283         const struct lu_fid *fid = lu_object_fid(&obj->oo_dt.do_lu);
01284         dmu_object_type_t    type = DMU_OT_PLAIN_FILE_CONTENTS;
01285 
01286         /* Assert that the transaction has been assigned to a
01287            transaction group. */
01288         LASSERT(tx->tx_txg != 0);
01289 
01290         /* Use DMU_OTN_UINT8_METADATA for local objects so their data blocks
01291          * would get an additional ditto copy */
01292         if (unlikely(S_ISREG(la->la_mode) &&
01293                      fid_seq_is_local_file(fid_seq(fid))))
01294                 type = DMU_OTN_UINT8_METADATA;
01295 
01296         /* Create a new DMU object. */
01297         oid = dmu_object_alloc(osd->od_os, type, 0,
01298                                DMU_OT_SA, DN_MAX_BONUSLEN, tx);
01299         rc = -sa_buf_hold(osd->od_os, oid, osd_obj_tag, dbp);
01300         LASSERTF(rc == 0, "sa_buf_hold "LPU64" failed: %d\n", oid, rc);
01301 
01302         LASSERT(la->la_valid & LA_MODE);
01303         la->la_size = 0;
01304         la->la_nlink = 1;
01305 
01306         rc = __osd_attr_init(env, osd, oid, tx, la, parent);
01307         if (rc != 0) {
01308                 sa_buf_rele(*dbp, osd_obj_tag);
01309                 *dbp = NULL;
01310                 dmu_object_free(osd->od_os, oid, tx);
01311                 return rc;
01312         }
01313 
01314         return 0;
01315 }
01316 
01317 /*
01318  * The transaction passed to this routine must have
01319  * dmu_tx_hold_zap(tx, DMU_NEW_OBJECT, ...) called and then assigned
01320  * to a transaction group.
01321  *
01322  * Using ZAP_FLAG_HASH64 will force the ZAP to always be a FAT ZAP.
01323  * This is fine for directories today, because storing the FID in the dirent
01324  * will also require a FAT ZAP.  If there is a new type of micro ZAP created
01325  * then we might need to re-evaluate the use of this flag and instead do
01326  * a conversion from the different internal ZAP hash formats being used. */
01327 int __osd_zap_create(const struct lu_env *env, struct osd_device *osd,
01328                      dmu_buf_t **zap_dbp, dmu_tx_t *tx,
01329                      struct lu_attr *la, uint64_t parent, zap_flags_t flags)
01330 {
01331         uint64_t oid;
01332         int      rc;
01333 
01334         /* Assert that the transaction has been assigned to a
01335            transaction group. */
01336         LASSERT(tx->tx_txg != 0);
01337 
01338         oid = zap_create_flags(osd->od_os, 0, flags | ZAP_FLAG_HASH64,
01339                                DMU_OT_DIRECTORY_CONTENTS,
01340                                14, /* == ZFS fzap_default_block_shift */
01341                                DN_MAX_INDBLKSHIFT, /* indirect block shift */
01342                                DMU_OT_SA, DN_MAX_BONUSLEN, tx);
01343 
01344         rc = -sa_buf_hold(osd->od_os, oid, osd_obj_tag, zap_dbp);
01345         if (rc)
01346                 return rc;
01347 
01348         LASSERT(la->la_valid & LA_MODE);
01349         la->la_size = 2;
01350         la->la_nlink = 1;
01351 
01352         return __osd_attr_init(env, osd, oid, tx, la, parent);
01353 }
01354 
01355 static dmu_buf_t *osd_mkidx(const struct lu_env *env, struct osd_object *obj,
01356                             struct lu_attr *la, uint64_t parent,
01357                             struct osd_thandle *oh)
01358 {
01359         dmu_buf_t *db;
01360         int        rc;
01361 
01362         /* Index file should be created as regular file in order not to confuse
01363          * ZPL which could interpret them as directory.
01364          * We set ZAP_FLAG_UINT64_KEY to let ZFS know than we are going to use
01365          * binary keys */
01366         LASSERT(S_ISREG(la->la_mode));
01367         rc = __osd_zap_create(env, osd_obj2dev(obj), &db, oh->ot_tx, la, parent,
01368                               ZAP_FLAG_UINT64_KEY);
01369         if (rc)
01370                 return ERR_PTR(rc);
01371         return db;
01372 }
01373 
01374 static dmu_buf_t *osd_mkdir(const struct lu_env *env, struct osd_object *obj,
01375                             struct lu_attr *la, uint64_t parent,
01376                             struct osd_thandle *oh)
01377 {
01378         dmu_buf_t *db;
01379         int        rc;
01380 
01381         LASSERT(S_ISDIR(la->la_mode));
01382         rc = __osd_zap_create(env, osd_obj2dev(obj), &db,
01383                               oh->ot_tx, la, parent, 0);
01384         if (rc)
01385                 return ERR_PTR(rc);
01386         return db;
01387 }
01388 
01389 static dmu_buf_t *osd_mkreg(const struct lu_env *env, struct osd_object *obj,
01390                             struct lu_attr *la, uint64_t parent,
01391                             struct osd_thandle *oh)
01392 {
01393         dmu_buf_t         *db;
01394         int                rc;
01395         struct osd_device *osd = osd_obj2dev(obj);
01396 
01397         LASSERT(S_ISREG(la->la_mode));
01398         rc = __osd_object_create(env, obj, &db, oh->ot_tx, la, parent);
01399         if (rc)
01400                 return ERR_PTR(rc);
01401 
01402         /*
01403          * XXX: This heuristic is non-optimal.  It would be better to
01404          * increase the blocksize up to osd->od_max_blksz during the write.
01405          * This is exactly how the ZPL behaves and it ensures that the right
01406          * blocksize is selected based on the file size rather than the
01407          * making broad assumptions based on the osd type.
01408          */
01409         if (!lu_device_is_md(osd2lu_dev(osd))) {
01410                 rc = -dmu_object_set_blocksize(osd->od_os, db->db_object,
01411                                                osd->od_max_blksz, 0, oh->ot_tx);
01412                 if (unlikely(rc)) {
01413                         CERROR("%s: can't change blocksize: %d\n",
01414                                osd->od_svname, rc);
01415                         return ERR_PTR(rc);
01416                 }
01417         }
01418 
01419         return db;
01420 }
01421 
01422 static dmu_buf_t *osd_mksym(const struct lu_env *env, struct osd_object *obj,
01423                             struct lu_attr *la, uint64_t parent,
01424                             struct osd_thandle *oh)
01425 {
01426         dmu_buf_t *db;
01427         int        rc;
01428 
01429         LASSERT(S_ISLNK(la->la_mode));
01430         rc = __osd_object_create(env, obj, &db, oh->ot_tx, la, parent);
01431         if (rc)
01432                 return ERR_PTR(rc);
01433         return db;
01434 }
01435 
01436 static dmu_buf_t *osd_mknod(const struct lu_env *env, struct osd_object *obj,
01437                             struct lu_attr *la, uint64_t parent,
01438                             struct osd_thandle *oh)
01439 {
01440         dmu_buf_t *db;
01441         int        rc;
01442 
01443         la->la_valid = LA_MODE;
01444         if (S_ISCHR(la->la_mode) || S_ISBLK(la->la_mode))
01445                 la->la_valid |= LA_RDEV;
01446 
01447         rc = __osd_object_create(env, obj, &db, oh->ot_tx, la, parent);
01448         if (rc)
01449                 return ERR_PTR(rc);
01450         return db;
01451 }
01452 
01453 typedef dmu_buf_t *(*osd_obj_type_f)(const struct lu_env *env,
01454                                      struct osd_object *obj,
01455                                      struct lu_attr *la,
01456                                      uint64_t parent,
01457                                      struct osd_thandle *oh);
01458 
01459 static osd_obj_type_f osd_create_type_f(enum dt_format_type type)
01460 {
01461         osd_obj_type_f result;
01462 
01463         switch (type) {
01464         case DFT_DIR:
01465                 result = osd_mkdir;
01466                 break;
01467         case DFT_INDEX:
01468                 result = osd_mkidx;
01469                 break;
01470         case DFT_REGULAR:
01471                 result = osd_mkreg;
01472                 break;
01473         case DFT_SYM:
01474                 result = osd_mksym;
01475                 break;
01476         case DFT_NODE:
01477                 result = osd_mknod;
01478                 break;
01479         default:
01480                 LBUG();
01481                 break;
01482         }
01483         return result;
01484 }
01485 
01486 /*
01487  * Primitives for directory (i.e. ZAP) handling
01488  */
01489 static inline int osd_init_lma(const struct lu_env *env, struct osd_object *obj,
01490                                const struct lu_fid *fid, struct osd_thandle *oh)
01491 {
01492         struct osd_thread_info  *info = osd_oti_get(env);
01493         struct lustre_mdt_attrs *lma = &info->oti_mdt_attrs;
01494         struct lu_buf            buf;
01495         int rc;
01496 
01497         lustre_lma_init(lma, fid, 0, 0);
01498         lustre_lma_swab(lma);
01499         buf.lb_buf = lma;
01500         buf.lb_len = sizeof(*lma);
01501 
01502         rc = osd_xattr_set_internal(env, obj, &buf, XATTR_NAME_LMA,
01503                                     LU_XATTR_CREATE, oh);
01504 
01505         return rc;
01506 }
01507 
01508 /*
01509  * Concurrency: @dt is write locked.
01510  */
01511 static int osd_object_create(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_object *dt,
01512                              struct lu_attr *attr,
01513                              struct dt_allocation_hint *hint,
01514                              struct dt_object_format *dof,
01515                              struct thandle *th)
01516 {
01517         struct zpl_direntry     *zde = &osd_oti_get(env)->oti_zde.lzd_reg;
01518         const struct lu_fid     *fid = lu_object_fid(&dt->do_lu);
01519         struct osd_object       *obj = osd_dt_obj(dt);
01520         struct osd_device       *osd = osd_obj2dev(obj);
01521         char                    *buf = osd_oti_get(env)->oti_str;
01522         struct osd_thandle      *oh;
01523         dmu_buf_t               *db;
01524         uint64_t                 zapid;
01525         int                      rc;
01526 
01527         ENTRY;
01528 
01529         /* concurrent create declarations should not see
01530          * the object inconsistent (db, attr, etc).
01531          * in regular cases acquisition should be cheap */
01532         down_write(&obj->oo_guard);
01533 
01534         if (unlikely(dt_object_exists(dt)))
01535                 GOTO(out, rc = -EEXIST);
01536 
01537         LASSERT(osd_invariant(obj));
01538         LASSERT(dof != NULL);
01539 
01540         LASSERT(th != NULL);
01541         oh = container_of0(th, struct osd_thandle, ot_super);
01542 
01543         /*
01544          * XXX missing: Quote handling.
01545          */
01546 
01547         LASSERT(obj->oo_db == NULL);
01548 
01549         /* to follow ZFS on-disk format we need
01550          * to initialize parent dnode properly */
01551         zapid = 0;
01552         if (hint != NULL && hint->dah_parent != NULL &&
01553             !dt_object_remote(hint->dah_parent))
01554                 zapid = osd_dt_obj(hint->dah_parent)->oo_db->db_object;
01555 
01556         db = osd_create_type_f(dof->dof_type)(env, obj, attr, zapid, oh);
01557         if (IS_ERR(db))
01558                 GOTO(out, rc = PTR_ERR(db));
01559 
01560         zde->zde_pad = 0;
01561         zde->zde_dnode = db->db_object;
01562         zde->zde_type = IFTODT(attr->la_mode & S_IFMT);
01563 
01564         zapid = osd_get_name_n_idx(env, osd, fid, buf);
01565 
01566         rc = -zap_add(osd->od_os, zapid, buf, 8, 1, zde, oh->ot_tx);
01567         if (rc)
01568                 GOTO(out, rc);
01569 
01570         /* Add new object to inode accounting.
01571          * Errors are not considered as fatal */
01572         rc = -zap_increment_int(osd->od_os, osd->od_iusr_oid,
01573                                 (attr->la_valid & LA_UID) ? attr->la_uid : 0, 1,
01574                                 oh->ot_tx);
01575         if (rc)
01576                 CERROR("%s: failed to add "DFID" to accounting ZAP for usr %d "
01577                         "(%d)\n", osd->od_svname, PFID(fid), attr->la_uid, rc);
01578         rc = -zap_increment_int(osd->od_os, osd->od_igrp_oid,
01579                                 (attr->la_valid & LA_GID) ? attr->la_gid : 0, 1,
01580                                 oh->ot_tx);
01581         if (rc)
01582                 CERROR("%s: failed to add "DFID" to accounting ZAP for grp %d "
01583                         "(%d)\n", osd->od_svname, PFID(fid), attr->la_gid, rc);
01584 
01585         /* configure new osd object */
01586         obj->oo_db = db;
01587         rc = osd_object_init0(env, obj);
01588         LASSERT(ergo(rc == 0, dt_object_exists(dt)));
01589         LASSERT(osd_invariant(obj));
01590 
01591         rc = osd_init_lma(env, obj, fid, oh);
01592         if (rc != 0)
01593                 CERROR("%s: can not set LMA on "DFID": rc = %d\n",
01594                        osd->od_svname, PFID(fid), rc);
01595 
01596 out:
01597         up_write(&obj->oo_guard);
01598         RETURN(rc);
01599 }
01600 
01601 static int osd_declare_object_ref_add(const struct lu_env *env,
01602                                       struct dt_object *dt,
01603                                       struct thandle *th)
01604 {
01605         return osd_declare_attr_set(env, dt, NULL, th);
01606 }
01607 
01608 /*
01609  * Concurrency: @dt is write locked.
01610  */
01611 static int osd_object_ref_add(const struct lu_env *env,
01612                               struct dt_object *dt,
01613                               struct thandle *handle)
01614 {
01615         struct osd_object       *obj = osd_dt_obj(dt);
01616         struct osd_thandle      *oh;
01617         struct osd_device       *osd = osd_obj2dev(obj);
01618         uint64_t                 nlink;
01619         int rc;
01620 
01621         ENTRY;
01622 
01623         down_read(&obj->oo_guard);
01624         if (unlikely(!dt_object_exists(dt) || obj->oo_destroyed))
01625                 GOTO(out, rc = -ENOENT);
01626 
01627         LASSERT(osd_invariant(obj));
01628         LASSERT(obj->oo_sa_hdl != NULL);
01629 
01630         oh = container_of0(handle, struct osd_thandle, ot_super);
01631 
01632         write_lock(&obj->oo_attr_lock);
01633         nlink = ++obj->oo_attr.la_nlink;
01634         write_unlock(&obj->oo_attr_lock);
01635 
01636         rc = osd_object_sa_update(obj, SA_ZPL_LINKS(osd), &nlink, 8, oh);
01637 
01638 out:
01639         up_read(&obj->oo_guard);
01640         RETURN(rc);
01641 }
01642 
01643 static int osd_declare_object_ref_del(const struct lu_env *env,
01644                                       struct dt_object *dt,
01645                                       struct thandle *handle)
01646 {
01647         return osd_declare_attr_set(env, dt, NULL, handle);
01648 }
01649 
01650 /*
01651  * Concurrency: @dt is write locked.
01652  */
01653 static int osd_object_ref_del(const struct lu_env *env,
01654                               struct dt_object *dt,
01655                               struct thandle *handle)
01656 {
01657         struct osd_object       *obj = osd_dt_obj(dt);
01658         struct osd_thandle      *oh;
01659         struct osd_device       *osd = osd_obj2dev(obj);
01660         uint64_t                 nlink;
01661         int                      rc;
01662 
01663         ENTRY;
01664 
01665         down_read(&obj->oo_guard);
01666 
01667         if (unlikely(!dt_object_exists(dt) || obj->oo_destroyed))
01668                 GOTO(out, rc = -ENOENT);
01669 
01670         LASSERT(osd_invariant(obj));
01671         LASSERT(obj->oo_sa_hdl != NULL);
01672 
01673         oh = container_of0(handle, struct osd_thandle, ot_super);
01674         LASSERT(!lu_object_is_dying(dt->do_lu.lo_header));
01675 
01676         write_lock(&obj->oo_attr_lock);
01677         nlink = --obj->oo_attr.la_nlink;
01678         write_unlock(&obj->oo_attr_lock);
01679 
01680         rc = osd_object_sa_update(obj, SA_ZPL_LINKS(osd), &nlink, 8, oh);
01681 
01682 out:
01683         up_read(&obj->oo_guard);
01684         RETURN(rc);
01685 }
01686 
01687 static int osd_object_sync(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_object *dt,
01688                            __u64 start, __u64 end)
01689 {
01690         struct osd_device *osd = osd_obj2dev(osd_dt_obj(dt));
01691         ENTRY;
01692 
01693         /* XXX: no other option than syncing the whole filesystem until we
01694          * support ZIL.  If the object tracked the txg that it was last
01695          * modified in, it could pass that txg here instead of "0".  Maybe
01696          * the changes are already committed, so no wait is needed at all? */
01697         txg_wait_synced(dmu_objset_pool(osd->od_os), 0ULL);
01698 
01699         RETURN(0);
01700 }
01701

01739 static int osd_otable_it_attr_get(const struct lu_env *env,
01740                                 struct dt_object *dt,
01741                                 struct lu_attr *attr)
